alert.note: Alert for Elko; Eureka; Lander (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued May 28 at 6:54PM PDT until May 28 at 8:45PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: The National Weather Service in Elko Nevada has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northeastern Lander County in north central Nevada... South central Elko County in northeastern Nevada... Northern Eureka County in north central Nevada... * Until 845 PM PDT. * At 645 PM PDT, a dust channel approaching western Lander County was moving northeast at 40 mph. Dust will pass over portions of Lander, Eureka Counties through 800 PM and then make its way into South Central Elko County after 800 PM. HAZARD...Less than three miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Satellite detected. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. Roadways most affected will be SR-305 from Battle Mountain to Austin, portions of SR-306 from Beowawe to Austin, and I-80 from Battle Mountain east to Deeth. Locations impacted include... Elko, Carlin, South Fork, Crescent Valley, Pine Valley, Dunphy, Beowawe, Grass Valley, Jiggs, Ryndon, Emigrant Pass, Spring Creek, Palisade, Adobe Summit, Mount Tenabo, Mule Canyon Reclamation Project, Antelope Valley, Lamoille Summit, Mount Callaghan and Emigrant Mine. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust can be unhealthy and has been known to lead to Valley Fever. Avoid outdoor exposure. Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
